list_definition.definition: a long pointed tooth especially of a fierce animal

list_ex_of_english: In his view, the venom is inoculated by the fangs of a snake, or the spur of a scorpion, which, he says, he observed to be hollow.
Fang and his wife to leave, and are glad that we have been able to contribute to a positive solution to this long-standing problem.
Lkhe was wearing a golden dress with heavy bells around his waist and a red mask with wide eyes and large fangs.
In order to bite, the viper must open its jaws and make a strike downward so that its fangs reach the prey.
He began to talk about the full moon and fangs growing.
I hesitate to use the word "fangs" but my garlic is ready.
No harm can be done because the fang of the settlement has been drawn and it cannot sting during its surviving life.
